quote1.quote: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move.
quote1.author: Douglas Adams

quote2.quote: Anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job.
quote2.author: Douglas Adams

quote3.quote: Rock journalism is people who can't write interviewing people who can't talk for people who can't read.
quote3.author: Frank Zappa

quote4.quote: A mind is like a parachute. It doesn't work if it is not open.
quote4.author: Frank Zappa

quote5.quote: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.
quote5.author: Albert Einstein

quote6.quote: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
quote6.author: Albert Einstein

quote7.quote: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
quote7.author: Albert Einstein

quote8.quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow; learn as if you were to live forever.
quote8.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote9.quote: First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win.
quote9.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote10.quote: Why can't I just eat my waffle?
quote10.author: Barack Obama

quote11.quote: When we hear a very sad song, it makes us realise that we do share this kind of common human experience, and we're all kind of bonded in sadness and melancholia and depression.
quote11.author: Steven Wilson

quote12.quote: If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all.
quote12.author: Noam Chomsky

quote13.quote: The more you can increase fear of drugs and crime, welfare mothers, immigrants and aliens, the more you control all the people.
quote13.author: Noam Chomsky

quote14.quote: Too many pieces of music finish too long after the end.
quote14.author: Igor Stravinksy

quote15.quote: Music is the silence between the notes.
quote15.author: Claude Debussy

quote16.quote: At the age of six I wanted to be a cook. At seven I wanted to be Napoleon. And my ambition has been growing steadily ever since.
quote16.author: Salvador Dali

quote17.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
quote17.author: Pablo Picasso

quote18.quote: First thing we do, let's kill all the lawyers.
quote18.author: William Shakespeare

quote19.quote: 'I'm bored' is a useless thing to say. You live in a great, big, vast world that you've seen none percent of.
quote19.author: Louis C.K.

quote20.quote: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
quote20.author: Winston Churchill
